thread.title: Chinese forestry tourism's output hits USD103b in 2014
thread.title_full: Chinese forestry tourism's output hits USD103b in 2014 | MENAFN.COM

title: Chinese forestry tourism's output hits USD103b in 2014
text:
(MENAFN) China's forestry tourism has witnessed an ongoing progress with enormous potential in the future, with the output value of the nation's forestry tourism reaching USD103 billion in 2014.

Forest tourists totaled to 910 million last year in the country, or one fourth of the nation's overall domestic tourists, according to the recent statistics released from the State Forestry Administration.

In 2014, China had more than 8,500 forestry tourism locations and built 3,101 forest parks nationwide, let alone that the nation's policy to preserve state-owned forests which will bring new opportunities for tourism.

"Visiting forests for a breath of fresh air and relaxation has become increasingly popular among China's urban dwellers," declared the deputy head of the State Forestry Administration.
